p: Some of 2,4-disubstituted thiazole derivatives have been synthesized and evaluated for their antitumor activity by the NCI in vitro disease-oriented antitumor screen. The tested compounds showed antineoplastic activity. All of the active compounds in the present study ( 43a, 43b, 44a and 44b) exhibited activity with GI 50 values of 17.8, 8.5, 9.5, and 7.4 µM, respectively and proved to be nonselective with broad-spectrum antitumor activity against the nine tumor subpanels used with ratios of 0.2-1.7 for GI 50 and 0.4-1.7 for TGI.
